brief_description: Innate Immune Pathways in Elderly and Immunosuppressed Populations
brief_title: Innate Immune Pathways in Elderly and Immunosuppressed Populations 2012
description: Innate Immune Pathways in Elderly and Immunosuppressed Populations
endpoints: Enrollment of sufficient subjects to achieve statistically significantly experimental results.
hypothesis: Age, functional status as manifested by frailty, and immunosuppressive medications will alter Nod-like receptor (NLR) and/or Rig-I like receptor (RLR) function.
objectives: Define consequences of aging, functional status, and immunosuppression on NLR and RLR expression and function. Define mechanisms of immune dysregulation that reduce vaccine responsiveness and resistance to infection.
official_title: Innate Immune Pathways in Elderly and Immunosuppressed Populations 2012

arm.description: Individuals age > 21 with Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) who satisfy the 1987 American College of Rheumatology revised criteria for RA
arm.name: Immunosuppressed

program.contract_name: Innate Immune Pathways in Elderly and Immunosuppressed Populations SP2 Yale
